result.execSummary:
The defendant Anthony J. Pantalons was found guilty of the following charge(s) in this case.

  • Resisting an Officer, a class A misdemeanor, Wisconsin Statutes 946.41(1).

Notice to employers: It may be a violation of state law to discriminate against a job applicant because of an arrest or conviction record. Generally speaking, an employer may refuse to hire an applicant on the basis of a conviction only if the circumstances of the conviction substantially relate to the particular job. For more information, see Wisconsin Statute 111.335 and the Department of Workforce Development's publication, Arrest and Conviction Records under the Law.

supervisions.notes: In the event probation is revoked, Defendant would be entitled to Good Time Credit and Huber Privileges.

miscConds.notes: Court orders bond on file in the amount of $300 to be applied. Balance of costs to be paid directly to the Waushara County Clerk of Court within 60 days or establish a payment plan.  Failure to pay may result in suspension of your driver's license, tax intercept, a civil judgment being entered against you, a warrant being issued for your arrest for contempt and/or the debt being turned over to a collection agency.
Defendant to undergo an alcohol and other drug assessment and comply with any further counseling and/or treatment as deemed appropriate by the supervising agent.

The defendant must maintain absolute sobriety, may not be present upon the premises of any bars, and is prohibited from possessing/ingesting any impairing substances that have not been prescribed by a physician.
Defendant is to comply with any rules/recommendations as deemed appropriate by the supervising agent.   DNA sample to be provided and surcharge assessed.

judgments.action: Guilty Due to No Contest Plea

charges.dispoDesc: Guilty Due to No Contest Plea

result.caption: State of Wisconsin vs. Anthony J. Pantalons

records.descr: Records of prosec. are converted data. See file.

records.addlTxt: 937 am cases called-16CM72 & 16CM532. Defendant Anthony J. Pantalons in court.  Scott C. Blader appeared for the State of Wisconsin. Court goes over case and questions defendant regarding counsel. Defendant states he has to make a payment for SPD respresentation and then an attorney would be appointed to him. Defendant states he will be making the payment for counsel this week. Court schedules STC in person for payment to SPD and appointment of counsel. Court questions defendant regarding non-payment of fees in 16CM72.  Status conference scheduled for April 10, 2017 at 03:45 pm.

NOT PUT OF RECORD. Attorney Earl John Luaders in court.  Scott C. Blader appeared for the State of Wisconsin. Attorney Luaders states request to withdraw as counsel and believes it is in the mail. Court schedules in person STC to address counsel issue.  Status conference scheduled for March 14, 2017 at 09:30 am.
Status conference on March 14, 2017 at 09:30 am.
Status conference on February 20, 2017 at 02:05 pm.

11:19 pm cases called-16CM72 & 16TR461. Defendant Anthony J. Pantalons in court with attorney Earl John Luaders.  Steven Paul Anderson appeared for the State of Wisconsin.   Defendant advised of minimum/maximum penalty.  Plea QN reviewed w/Defendant.  Plea colloquy entertained.  Collateral consequences explained. Chapter 950 compliance addressed.  Plea: No Contest to 16CM72. Court accepts plea and enters JOC. Court dismisses and reads-in 16TR461. Statement by defendant. Court sentences the defendant to: Impose 90 days WCJ, STAYED and places on probation for a period of 1 year. If revoked, with Huber and Good Time Credit. CONTITIONS:   The defendant must maintain absolute sobriety, may not be present upon the premises of any bars, and is prohibited from possessing/ingesting any impairing substances that have not been prescribed by a physician. AODA and follow through. Terms of Agent. Costs to be paid within 60 days or paymet plan.  Court orders bond on file to be applied. DNA Sample and Surcharge ordered by the Court.  Defendant advised of right to expunge DNA record through the Department of Justice. Appeal Rights Given.
Plea/sentencing hearing on June 28, 2016 at 11:00 am.

NOT PUT OF RECORD: Attorney Earl John Luaders' assistant called in.  Scott C. Blader appeared for the State of Wisconsin. Matter to be set for plea/sentencing per assistant.  Plea/sentencing hearing scheduled for June 28, 2016 at 11:00 am.
Status conference on May 31, 2016 at 09:25 am.

NOT PUT OF RECORD: Defendant Anthony J. Pantalons in court with attorney Earl John Luaders both appear telephonically.  Scott C. Blader appeared for the State of Wisconsin. Attorney Luaders requesting another STC.  Status conference scheduled for May 31, 2016 at 09:25 am.
Status conference on April 27, 2016 at 03:30 pm.
No operation of any motor vehicles without a valid driver's license.  Executed bond form to be returned directly to the Clerk of Circuit Court no later than April 5, 2016.

Case Called @ 3:01 PM: Attorney Earl John Luaders in court, appearing via telephone.  Steven Paul Anderson appeared for the State of Wisconsin. Complaint Stated - Advised of offense and minimum/maximum penalty.  Receipt Admitted - Reading Waived.    NGP received and entered as to both matters.  ADA argues for cash bond w/conditions.  No objection to bond request.  The Court: Orders $300 cash bond w/conditions.   Counsel to conduct an informal PTC.  STC Scheduled - NOH Given.  Court enters Riverside Ruling in favor of the State and probable cause finding as to each count alleged within the complaint.  Status conference scheduled for April 27, 2016 at 03:30 pm.
from Atty Luaders Re: Request for Telephone Appearance for IA on 3/29/2016 - Granted by the Court
